messages: a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:58): why the hell does the UCAS pre-registration form require you to choose six subject areas you may be interested in studying at higher education!?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:59): Pre-registration?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:00): (I guess this isn't the same as the thing where you choose six courses/universities to apply to)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:00): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: nowadays you're meant to get a UCAS card in Year 12/S5
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:01): this form is badly marked up and badly worded and illogical.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:01): Oh, okay
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:01): do not‚Ä¶receive‚Ä¶by mail
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:01): do‚Ä¶receive‚Ä¶by email
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:01): do‚Ä¶receive‚Ä¶by text messaging
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:01): can we not be consistent!?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:02): wonders if he can get away with putting just four subjects down

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:02): It's annoying when they take a mostly-understandable paper form and then migrate to an online system which doesn't work and doesn't make sense and is full of errors
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:02): (as, quite frankly, if I didn't get in for any of them, I wouldn't go to uni)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:02): it seems to have worked
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:02): and then charge you ¬£20 to apply onlnie instead of on paper
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:02): heh
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:03): *online
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:03): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: you're at Cam, aren't you?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:03): which college?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:03): nice
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:04): I think it is :-)

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:04): however you spell it :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:04): admittedly, my sister is far older than me (i.e., old enough to legally be my mother!)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:05): *Selwyn :-p
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:05): yeah, phonetically that makes more sense
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:05): :)

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:06): facedesks
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:06): typing what you want to say before pressing return helps.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:07): *(I'm planning on doing computational physics, having talked to various people, to a master's degree: neither of oxbridge offer it)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:08): I walk past Selwyn most days, but don't really know much about it except that I don't particularly like the name
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:08): the actual quad is nice, not so the rest of the site
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:09): Question 2 of my Computing homework (given to 16/17 y/os): "What is a _user interface_?"
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:10): now, time to try and get back to doing my homework :)

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:12): (My old physics teacher was quite happy that Cambridge forces you do to Natural Sciences for a year instead of something specialised like physics, since he originally went there to do chemistry and then changed his mind)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:14): writes date in ISO8601 form, just too confuse most of his teachers and prove he will not be forced to break specs :P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:14): (in the basic form, and therefore without hyphens)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:15): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: I haven't done any other sciences since before the two-year Standard Grade (GCSE equiv.) course started
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:16): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: ironically, I am actually better than some people who have done chemistry/biology Standard Grade
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:17): I occasionally wish I had done chemistry, but I've never liked biology at all really
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:18): There are a few options in the NatSci first year that don't require any previous knowledge, like, uh, geology

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:20): I will most likely go to Edi, and go straight into second year (as traditionally in Scotland you go to uni after S5 ‚Äî I'm staying on to S6 and will have done A-Level equivs. (some people just take two years to get to A-S level equivs.))

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:21): and going straight into second year limits the options for outside subjects, partly as you have extra teaching of the one or two things you'll be missing from the slightly more specialist course at uni
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:24): How much of the algorithm is actually designed by the programmers in large software development companies?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:24): has his doubts about quite how true what he is being taught is
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:25): "the algorithm"?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:31): i.e., a formal design such as that within HTML 5's UA requirements
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:44): as is taught, every tiny smallest stage is defined
